dialogues.text: I love you, Frank, but why do you always have to be such a killjoy? (beat) You only got one rocket. This damn thing ain't gonna steer itself. You need a pilot. (as he tilts his head at the moon) Besides, you ever seen a prettier moon? Frank looks at the moon.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What's he talking about, Frank? They ignore Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We're a quarter-million miles away. You'll never make it.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Sure I will. It'll be just like hitting a baseball to the moon. All I gotta do is get myself halfway there, the moon's gravity's gonna do the rest. I'll fire these things into deep space and let ‘em self-destruct. Frank thinks long and hard. Finally, he detaches his auxiliary 02 tank, tosses it to Hawk. He rips off Ethan's, too, tosses it over. Hawk clips them onto his MMU.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Somebody's gotta be first in every race. Guess it had to be me this time.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Like always, dammit. Frank pulls Ethan out of his MMU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All rapt by the sight on screen -- Hawk setting the payload assist module, talking to Tank.  114.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: Pitch should be set at 060 degrees.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger, 060.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airlock door opens. Frank floats into the cabin from the airlock, holding Ethan. Jerry is in Frank's face immediately.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: You can't let him do this. There's gotta be another way!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: There isn't. I'll explain later. (beat) What's our status here?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (shocked at Frank) The orbital maneuvering engines were destroyed in the fire. Computer guidance is gone, and we lost a few heat tiles.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How's Roger?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Concussion. (hesitates) He's out of action, Frank. You're gonna have to pilot this bird in. Frank swallows hard. He looks over at Tank.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: Don't look at me. I haven't flown anything bigger than a Cessna in thirty years. They hear Hawk's rich LAUGHTER over the RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: climbs into Ethan's vacant MMU, straps in, still laughing. The moon hangs overhead, feels so close you could reach out and grab it.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: (laughing) Hey, Frank, it's starting to look  115. like I got the better end of this deal.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Quit laughing, you dummy. You're using up oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Alright. Let's shoot this baby to the moon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks up a safety guard on a control panel and hovers his finger over a trigger. A poignant, sardonic grin overcomes him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm gonna countdown to one.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK AND HAWK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One! Frank hits the button. A bright light -- the P.A.M. IGNITES. The satellite begins to quake, then streaks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawk's head arcs back as he and the satellite accelerate to the moon, which is looming large ahead. Hawk's war whoop can barely be heard over the ROAR of the ENGINE. He makes course corrections with pulses from the nitrogen jets.

dialogues.speaker: ON SPACE SHUTTLE
dialogues.text: Pin-drop silence. Frank watches through the window. Hawk getting smaller, heading right for the moon. The PAM burns out (normal). Quiet.... then --

dialogues.speaker: HAWK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (singing, over radio) Fly me to the moon and let me play among the stars... STATIC CRACKLES as his voice transmission gets weaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara watches the trajectory screen at the front of the room. Drained -- exhausted mentally and physically. The  116. situation is serious. Davis comes out of a huddle with flight controllers, and motions Sara to join him at an unoccupied station.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Ikon has left our gravitational field. Hawk was able to launch the missiles into deep space. She nods slowly, a tear swelling up in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: How's Daedalus?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: She's a damaged ship. They're gonna have to reenter the atmosphere, find the correct glide slope, and put her down with no power and no computer.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Well, it's never been done. The only two pilots alive that could even think about it are Roger and Hawk. Roger's wounded and Hawk's... Sara shuts down emotions and is all business now.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Let's get them in as close as we can and abort the landing. They'1l have to bail out. What's the survival probability?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Twenty percent. At best. But it's zero if they try to set her down. The ship's dead. She might not even glide with the structural damage.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Twenty's better than zero. She places her headset back on, goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men go about preparations for reentry in silence. Full pressure suits, attached to their parachutes. Frank  117. eases the injured Roger into his, Tank helps Ethan. Both are helpless, look like children being dressed by a parent. Tank and Jerry retract the drag chute arm that will deploy under the shuttle's wing to release them when they jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits at the controls, warning lights blinking everywhere, reading a thick operations manual. Tank makes his way up.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: You all right? Frank nods. Tank looks compassionate.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: You gonna be able to do this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don't know. I never imagined having to without Hawk. He exhales a big sigh. Tank reaches into his pocket, pulls out...

dialogues.speaker: HULA GIRL
dialogues.text: from the dash of his B-50 in 1958. He sticks it on the instrument display panel, and she starts to dance. Frank looks at Tank like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You saved that thing?

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Daedalus. Stand by for Eugene Davis.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Frank, the judgement here is to go for California. We're gonna get you as close as we can to Edwards. Now you're still inverted. And you're flying tail first. Ordinarily, we'd do a de-orbit burn to right her --

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: -- but we don't have an engine to do that with.  118.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to jostle her a little -- bringing her around with your speed and a little gravity. Go easy, though. You're still at 17,000 miles per hour. Frank eases the stick over and around. She's not very responsive. He gives it a pull, and the ship snap-rolls, and begins shaking violently.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Whoaaaa, shit!

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Easy, Frank. She's not a fighter jet. Frank taps on the rudder pedals and pulls hard on the stick until the horizon changes. Earth is below him now, instead of over his head. He lets out the breath he's been holding.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay, we're righted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a small amount of shock on the faces. Davis lets out the breath he was holding.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: That's a good start. INTERCUT WITH Frank. Frank looks at the altimeter -- 400,000 feet.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Houston, we are at entry interface.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Roger, Frank. You're gonna punch in here in 15 seconds. I'm gonna lose you till you hit the stratosphere. Frank, you've shed some tiles. She's gonna heat up on you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Roger, Houston.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: 10 seconds. Frank, you've got the procedure. It's not optimum, but I want all you guys home.  119. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We copy. Daedalus out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Good luck, Frank. (to engineers) Okay, folks. Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank grabs the stick, glancing over at Tank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You wanna pray now, Rev?

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: What the hell you think I've been doing? Tank sees the worry and concentration in Frank's face and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: What would Hawk do? Frank shakes his head. He's not Hawk. The shuttle begins to bounce, entering our atmosphere. And heat up. With no orbital maneuvering engines, they're coming in more than 50 percent faster than they should. And the ride is about 100 percent more bumpy. Frank talks into his communicator. His voice shaking from the turbulence... at the very least.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's gonna be a very steep dive so we don't overshoot. I'm gonna have to pull a couple very tight turns to slow her down -- last one at 13,000. At ten, we'll be over California. I want everybody up and clipped then. I'm blowing the hatch at 5,000 and out we go. Ethan and Roger first, make sure they clear the wing. Everybody got that? They all affirm. And Frank pushes the nose over into a steep dive. DAEDALUS GROANS in response. Her airframe was not designed for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiles flake away, she's heating up to 2,000 degrees.  120. INT. SHUTTLE —- THAT MOMENT Agony in the faces. The ship bounces wildly, anything not locked down in steel flies about the cabin. The hula girl dances madly.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Come on, baby. Hold it together. Frank's knuckles are white, holding the stick, jamming the unresponsive rudders. First turn, over Japan, 50 miles up. She's heating up to 2500 now. And they're feeling it inside, the men sweating like crazy. The AIRFRAME is SCREECHING in protest.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: That's too steep, Frank! gonna fall apart on you! She's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They track the ship, unable to communicate.

dialogues.speaker: TRAJECTORY ENGINEER
dialogues.text: Altitude 30 miles, over Guam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skin's over 3000 now, the left wing shaking its rivets. INT. SHUTTLE —- THAT MOMENT It's an oven. Frank has to wipe the sweat away from his eyes to see. He tries to level off, but she won't respond. He fights, and curses it. Nothing. He stops, thinking, what would Hawk do? «+. Then throws the stick over -- a major, and unnatural bank. Then banks it right back across, zig-zagging to slow it down. Ethan screams in protest, at the same pitch as the BENDING METAL. But Roger nods. This will work. Frank pulls one last time, and they bank into their turn, heading south, over Hawaii.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That's it, baby. One more turn. Come on, line me up. Line me up... Frank battles with the stick like the Old Man and the Sea fighting the Great Fish. His face shows a warrior's  121. calm. The SHIP levels off at 10 miles, shaking and RATTLING like a '55 Chevy on a dirt road, and turns for home. And Frank's agonized grimace eases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURSTS of STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM
dialogues.text: He's trying to call, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: He's fried his antenna. Trajectory, where is he?

dialogues.speaker: TRAJECTORY
dialogues.text: He's on final. But he is way too hot. He's gonna overshoot to Colorado at this rate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment of calm is gone.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: 35,000. We're going way too fast. Looking ahead, cloud and marine layer at the California coast.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: We can't bail out at Mach 2, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm gliding at 22 degrees. We can slow down some, but the most we can hope for is Mach 1. That, or we go in 1,000 miles past.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: Your call. The decision. The shuttle feels like it could break up at any moment. The cloud cover looms ahead as they drop rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: Come up on 10.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Everybody up! Hook on! He begins to weave the shuttle in long back and forth  122. turns -- trying to slow her down.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION CONTROL
dialogues.text: Horror on the faces.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: No, Frank, no...

dialogues.speaker: SHUTTLE
dialogues.text: 7,000 feet. In the clouds. Mach 1.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Stand by. Okay, Tank. Clip on.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I just need a visual so I can line her up on Death Valley, and I'm out. Blowing the hatch! He throws a switch, the EXPLOSIVE BOLTS BLOW, and the 600 MPH WIND HOWLS through Daedalus.

dialogues.speaker: IN CREW CABIN
dialogues.text: Jerry muscles the drag chute arm into place, and clips Roger in.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jerry lifts him up, and shoves him out on the arm, keeping him clear of the wobbling wing.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: One gone! Jerry shoves Ethan forward, smiles as he lets him fly.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Two gone! And the clouds dissolve beneath them. Looking back, they can see two chutes opened, floating gently down.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Get out now!  123. Looking ahead, Frank can see they're too high for Edwards, too low to overshoot a desert oasis community of tract homes in the distance. The shuttle is on the line to crash right into it. Frank's decision is instantaneous. He's staying with it. He turns around to see Jerry and Tank, pausing at the hatchway.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What the hell are you waiting for? They unclip simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: We're a team, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Go, dammit! That's an order!

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: We're staying. Frank throws the stick over, plunging them down. Whatever momentum he lost, he's got it all back now. A normal 22 degree descent is now 50. They're heading in like a missile.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Airspeed?

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: 500! Pull it up! Frank holds the dive, seeing --

dialogues.speaker: TWO FIGHTER ESCORTS
dialogues.text: on either side.

dialogues.speaker: FIGHTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Daedalus, this is Recover Five. You're way too hot. Recommend abort -- Abort now! Frank levels it off.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Negative, Recover. I'm taking her in.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: 410. Here comes the runway.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No problem...  124. Just like Hawk in the simulator, he hums to himself, totally in his element, a look of peace overcomes him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: «+. you just gotta tap the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT watches in disbelief as the shuttle's nose pitches up.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Shit, he's lost it! Mayday, Mayday!! INT. SHUTTLE —- THAT MOMENT The STALL ALARM is WAILING. The left wing is about to go.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Call my airspeed.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: 350, 310, 280 -- she's stalling, Frank! You're gonna go over! Drop the nose!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Speed! ?

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: 215! Drop the nose!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Whattaya say we drop the nose? 10, 5, 2, 1... touchdown. She's wobbly, bouncing, leaning hard right with the damaged left wing. Frank stamps on the brakes as the drag chute opens -- and she levels off, a landing almost identical to Hawk's in the simulator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the shuttle roll gently to a stop at the far end of the runway. Barbara watches nervously.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Wheels stop. Daedalus is home. They rise as one, cheering wildly. Barbara bursts out crying. Sara grabs the woman and holds her tight. Davis sighs.  125.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: I'm getting too old for this shit.

dialogues.speaker: ON GERSON
dialogues.text: He hesitates for a moment, then forces a smile and claps his hands disingenuously.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The media rushes back into the room. Davis makes his way through the room shaking hands. He sees Sara staring at the screen, crying. He heads for her. Sara puts an arm on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Gene?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Never mind... (as Davis looks back at the screen) You think it's too late for me to re-join the program... as an astronaut?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: (modding at the big screen) That oughtta answer your question. She smiles. Something catches Davis's eye, he turns to see Gerson talking to a news crew.

dialogues.speaker: GERSON
dialogues.text: I never doubted Frank for a minute. I brought Frank on to Project Daedalus forty years ago, and I brought him in for this mission, and I can tell you this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Navy CH-54 rescue helicopter eases down. Two rescue personnel bound out to assist Ethan and Roger -- shaken, but standing. INT. SHUTTLE —- THAT MOMENT  126. Frank turns to look at Jerry and Tank.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Just a walk in the park, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: slumps back, closing his eyes. Opening his eyes slowly, he sees the only thing moving in the shuttle --

dialogues.speaker: HULA GIRL
dialogues.text: Her crazy jig slowly comes to an end.

dialogues.speaker: FULL MOON
dialogues.text: The sound of CRICKETS in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares at the moon, deep in thought. He doesn't notice Barbara joining him at his side.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: You think he made it? Frank slowly breaks into a pensive grin as "FLY ME TO THE MOON" FADES SLOWLY UP.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think he made it. His eyes travel back to the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are MOVING IN TOWARDS the moon, slowly, the shadowed contours of the sand dunes and craters getting sharper. SINATRA'S VOICE KICKS IN. Something PASSES us --

dialogues.speaker: SATELLITE IKON
dialogues.text: And as it passes, we see Hawk still attached to it in his MMU. The satellite gently hits the edge of a sand dune, the soft surface cushioning the impact. The satellite bounces once, throwing --

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Out of the MMU.  127.

dialogues.speaker: SATELLITE
dialogues.text: spins, topples over and lands back on the moon.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: arcs and tumbles through the air until the moon's gravity gently pulls him back down, on to the deep, pillow-soft moon dust, where he bounces once, then lays motionless.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON HAWK'S FACEPLATE
dialogues.text: The Earth is reflected, and we can't see his face, can't tell whether he's alive or dead. Then, in VOICE OVER we hear HAWK'S joyous LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying there, flat on his back. There is a deep impression around him in the lunar dust where he fell, especially around his arms and legs. Maybe it was the fall. Or maybe, like a kid at Winter's first snow fall, he was making angels in the virgin snow. FADE OUT.
